Bootstrap works like a grid where each individual square/ element can change size (which is limited however to shape and amount of
inside) and location of the page. Any information within these square/ elements will collapse and fill the space no matter how the size or the shape changes.
each element to be manoeuvred and manipulated around the page depending on the width and height of the page.
some of my element will be fixed in position and can only change width such as my navigation bar that will change from a bar of buttons with dropdowns to a

Menu systems are often a bind to get right especially if you want a multi-dropdown menu. In an ideal world you should write the HTML for a menu as a set of hierarchical un-numbered lists. Summarise how you will implement menus in your site using Bootstrap.
As mentioned before my program will use multi-dropdown menus

that will be displayed in a list of buttons, however when the page changes shape and size it will turn into a burger button multi-dropdown menu. The change into a burger menu allows the user to view the browser at any size and still have easy
around the site, this comes in handy especially for people viewing the site on mobile devices.
buttons and sub menus drop downs will be put in order from most
to the least likely to be clicked on. The order will be maintained across all pages to prevent users ha
ving to search each navigation menu for the navigation button they want to click, the order will also not be
if it is navigation bar or a burger dropdown menu.
Pick out 5 further features, other than grid and menu, in Bootstrap that you think will be useful. Comment on their use.
Alerts – This can be used for when a user is filling in a form for useful
such as if a required field has not been filled in or not met certain expected standards.

useful element that can be included for feedback for example if there was a quiz or form to be filled out a progress bar could be used to encourage a user to finish it due to the constant update on how close they are to the finishing point.

Popovers – These can be an incredible way to display information without having to take up to much room, for example if there was not enough room to put contact details on the page and it was not a huge requirement a simple button named “contact details” with a popover would be a great way to include it without using up much additional space.
Toasts – These are like alerts however these are less harsh and doesn’t suggest a problem like an alert would. Toasts can be used in
as they are more friendly than
they can be used for reminders, tasks to complete, useful popup links and even adverts.
a slide show element that can be used to display certain element in
order which can be controlled manually or automatically cycle through them. Each side can be set up for different things such as sample videos, images and linked images that can take users to pages.

You need to add 400 words of appraisal of the work carried out this week. Pick one of the API methods and describe how this works. Then show where this has been used within the “view” code. Are you convinced that an API is a good idea? The answer is YES, give a couple of reasons why!!

Remember that you need to add some weekly comments (400 words). Being able to login to a site is a key component for many web sites. Consider the security aspects that you have put into your site which is just to protect the comments section. What is you were selling items from your site? Talk a bit about whether the security you have on your site is
; and outline any improvements for a selling site. (300 words)

Inside of my website I added a login and register system that is required to be used when a user wants to post a comment. Register form gives feedback on the strength of the password making users want to aim to use more secure passwords. I also ask the user to confirm their password after entering it, this gets them thinking more about what their password is meaning they might realise their password is to unsecure. I also use a salting and hashing method encrypt the password before it is sent and stored in the database this encryption in irreversible, this means even if a user was to get the encrypted password, they couldn’t reverse engineer it. This is more than enough security to prevent people from posting malicious or dangerous comments from other accounts however, if my site was to sell items then it would require a lot more security as personal details such as bank details and addresses would be sent and possibly stored.
To make it securer a better encryption would be used, shorter sessions would be put in place in addition to a verification system when a

Depending on the size of the purchases on the site then a password should be required on the checkout of the purchase. I would also store the banking details in a separate table in the database to help protect
These extra safety methods mentioned would be
much to implement for my current website as the security is simply for comments, adding all that security would only drive the user away from wanting to post a comment as it would be considered
to much work for such a small return.
s clearly how you would set the session maximum length to 5 mins. (100 words)

To set a session length to 5 mins I would create my own session function, it would simply request the servers current time and store it. We would then check the users last active time stamp and compare this against the current time and check if the difference in seconds is > 300, if
() function to start the session then the
along with deleting the cookie that the session created
. This will remove anything that the session started and remove/ reset anything stored.
